All sentient beings revolve in the world due to two inverted discriminating views and delusions, arising in place and revolving in accordance with their karma.
What are the two views?
First, the deluded views of individual karmic retribution of sentient beings;
Second, the deluded views of the same karmic retribution of sentient beings.
What is meant by the deluded views of individual karmic retribution?
Ä€nanda!
It is like a person in the world with bloodshot eyes, who at night sees the light of a lamp as having a circular halo with five colors overlapping.
What do you think?
Is the circular light manifested by the lamp at night the color of the lamp or the color of the vision?
Ä€nanda!
If this is the color of the lamp, then why would those without bloodshot eyes not see it the same way, and why is this circular halo only seen by those with bloodshot eyes?
If it is seeing form, and having seen it becomes form, then what is the name of the person with blurred vision who sees a circular shadow?
Furthermore, Ä€nanda,

if it exists separately from the seeing, it should not be seen by the eyes. How can a person with blurred vision see a circular shadow with their eyes?

Therefore, you should know that the form truly exists in the lamp, the seeing is diseased, and the shadow is created by the seeing. The seeing and the shadow are both diseased, but the seeing of the disease is not itself a disease.
It should never be said that it is the lamp or it is the seeing, or that within it there is neither the lamp nor the seeing.
It is like the second moon, which is neither a substance nor a reflection.
Why is this?
Because the second moon is formed by pressing the eyes.
The wise should not say that the original basis of the pressing is a shape or not a shape, or that it is separate from the seeing or not separate from the seeing;

this is also like this. It is formed by the disease of the eyes. Now, what do you want to call it? Is it the lamp or is it the seeing? How much less can it be distinguished as neither the lamp nor the seeing.
What is meant by the same deluded perception?

In this JambudvÄ«pa, excluding the great ocean waters, the flat land in between has three thousand islands. The largest continent in the center is about two thousand three hundred large countries from east to west. The smaller islands are in the various oceans, with three or two hundred countries in between, some with one, some with two, up to thirty, forty, or fifty.
Ä€nanda!

If in this continent there is a small island with only two countries, and the people of only one country experience the same evil conditions, then the beings on that small island will see all kinds of inauspicious scenes.
They may see two suns or two moons, or even halos, eclipses, comets, flying meteors, negative ears, rainbows, and various other evil signs, but only the people of this country will see them;
the beings in the other country will neither see nor hear of them.
Ä€nanda!
I will now explain these two matters to you in terms of advancing and retreating together.

Like the illusory perceptions of sentient beings in their individual karmic retributions, the circular reflections that appear in the light of a lamp, although appearing to be objects, are ultimately formed by the eye disease of the viewer. The disease is the labor of seeing, not created by form. However, those who see the disease are never at fault in their seeing.

As an analogy, today you use your eyes to observe and see the mountains, rivers, countries, and all sentient beings, all of which are formed by the disease of seeing that has existed since beginningless time. Seeing and the conditions of seeing appear to be present objects, but they are originally the reflections of my enlightened and illuminating seeing. The enlightened seeing is itself a reflection. The originally enlightened and illuminating mind, the conditions of enlightenment, are not reflections. The enlightened one and the reflected one are reflections. The enlightenment that is not within reflections is truly seeing seeing.
How can it still be called enlightened seeing, hearing, knowing, and perceiving?
Therefore, what you now see of me, you, and all the sentient beings of the ten realms in the world are all illusory perceptions.
Those who are not seeing illusions, their true essence of seeing is not of the nature of illusions, and therefore it is not called seeing.
Ä€nanda!

Just as those sentient beings' shared deluded perceptions are similar to the deluded perceptions of a single person with a different karmic condition, and one person with an eye disease is similar to an entire country, the inauspicious appearances manifested by the shared karmic conditions arise from the evil miasmas of the shared karmic actions, and are all produced by the deluded perceptions of beginningless time.

As an analogy, in the continent of JambudvÄ«pa, the three thousand islands, the four great oceans, the SahÄ world, and the worlds with outflows and sentient beings in the ten directions, all share the wondrous mind of luminous awareness free from outflows, and the false conditions of seeing, hearing, awareness, and knowing. If one can distance oneself from the conditions of combination and non-combination, then one will also eliminate the causes of birth and death, perfect enlightenment, the nature free from birth and death, the originally pure mind, and the eternally abiding original enlightenment.

Although you have previously realized that the wondrous and bright essence of your original enlightenment is neither due to causes and conditions, nor due to spontaneity, you still do not understand that this original enlightenment is neither born from a combination of causes and conditions, nor is it not born from a combination of causes and conditions.

Suppose someone with clear eyes looks at a clear, cloudless sky, seeing only a pure void with nothing at all. If that person, for no reason, moves their eyes and stares until they become fatigued, they will see strange flowers in the empty sky, and all kinds of strange and disordered appearances.

If they came from the sky, since they came from the sky they would return to the sky. If they come and go, they are not empty space. If space were not empty, it would not allow the arising and ceasing of flower appearances, just as Ä€nanda's body does not allow Ä€nanda.
